intro: Agoseris parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered agoseris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Agoseris parviflora is often found in open meadows and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
